html:
386 U.S. 274

87 S.Ct. 1035

18 L.Ed.2d 43

William Earl COTTER, Jr.
v.
CALIFORNIA.

No. 38, Misc.

Supreme Court of the United States

March 13, 1967

William Earl Cotter, pro se.

Thomas C. Lynch, Atty. Gen. of California, William E. James, Asst. Atty. Gen., and Gordon Ringer, Deputy Atty. Gen., for respondent.

On Petition for Writ of Certiorari to the Supreme Court of California.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgment is vacated and the case remanded for further consideration in light of Chapman v. State of California, 386 U.S. 18, 87 S.Ct. 824.

2

Mr. Justice STEWART would grant certiorari and reverse the judgment for the reasons stated in his opinion concurring in the result in Chapman v. State of California, 386 U.S., at 42, 87 S.Ct., at 837.
html_lawbox:
386 U.S. 274 (1967)

COTTER
v.
CALIFORNIA.

No. 38, Misc.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided March 13, 1967.
ON PETITION FOR WRIT OF CERTIORARI TO THE SUPREME COURT OF CALIFORNIA.

Petitioner pro se.

Thomas C. Lynch, Attorney General of California, William E. James, Assistant Attorney General, and Gordon Ringer, Deputy Attorney General, for respondent.

PER CURIAM.

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgment is vacated and the case remanded for further consideration in light of Chapman v. California, ante, p. 18.

MR. JUSTICE STEWART would grant certiorari and reverse the judgment for the reasons stated in his opinion concurring in the result in Chapman v. California, ante, at 42.
